column5: Hello all, I am a new member from Scotland. I will be in the area in a couple of months. I had already posted in a different section http://www.ofncommunity.com/forums/index.php?showtopic=22028 but was advised to post here too. Any help with info will be much appreciated.  Wullie
there you go and if I didn't say it welcome to the site.
welcome aboard dude - whatcha lookin' to hook into while you're here?  Cheers, UF

"First of all, hello, I am Wullie and I am from central Scotland. I am visiting my cousin and her family in Markham the last 2 weeks in september. I am looking for info and perhaps company for a day or so to do some river fly fishing for trout while I am over. Tackle, flies needed etc as I am not sure what I will be bringing and what I may buy locally." Trout season is over for now,, BUT there a few CARP fishermen in the Toronto(Markham) area on this board that might be able to help you out.  have a nice vacation eh.  Splashhopper
Welcome to OFC... Hope someone in here can help you out  Enjoy your stay in Markham.  Leechman

I believe Wullie is supposed to be visiting in early septmeber.  I'm not a fly fisherman, but the salmon should be in full force at that point, as well as some nice big steelhead.  Great time of year to visit if you ask me.  I'm sure some of our resident fly guys could help you out!  Good luck, UF

If you're not looking for great lakes run fish, there are plenty of trout streams to fish in your area. If you were staying a little closer to where I am, I'd gladly divulge a few good fly fishing streams for ya. I'm sure someone in the area may be able to help you out though.
any of the eastern lake ontario tribs from oshawa to cobourg have good resident browns that love to rise for dry flys go with terrestrials and you should do good
Welcome, glad to see you didnt make the same mistake as i did.
Welcome to the board. As mentioned September is Salmon time in this neck of the woods...

Thanks for the replies fellas. If the trout season is going to be finished before end Sept, what gear will I need and flies for fishing the rouge river as it looks kinda close to where I am staying. What species am I likely to encounter that are in season then  Wullie
What mistake was that Ciceri?  Wullie
check this out for all the season info in that area. Zone 17 PDF from the MNR site
Thanks GBW. Looks like trout are in season while I'm over so I'll bring my usual trout catchers and take it from there.  Wullie

No problem, also check the pdf in the other thread as it has info on what is in the waters close to you.  Have fun and a Eight-day Conservation Fishing Licence should only run you $24.55 as Non-Resident of Canada.

Hi again. I am now in Markham and looking for access points to the rouge river. Today I had a look at the river below the dam at 'vinegar hill' area. (thats what my cousins husband call it anyway) It was very heavy with suspended dirt, although the water level looked good. I wondered if this wouldrun off further below markham greens golf course as it is the style of river I really love fishing at home. I will be heading up the haliburton hills to thier cabin on sunday, which is on beech lake. Does anyone know if this is any good on the fly?  Thanks in advance  Wullie
Hey Wullie,  check your pm box.  Stan
